revised_title: Spectroscopic Investigations of Nitrogen Compounds: Silicon and Titanium Tetrachlorides
tldr: The authors investigate the spectroscopic properties of nitrogen compounds formed by silicon and titanium tetrachlorides. They discover that silicon tetrachloride produces a nitride of silicon, while titanium tetrachloride does not show any spectrum attributable to a nitride. The study provides insights into the chemical behavior of these compounds and their interactions with active nitrogen.
